Journal Story: Just received my trail data book from the ATC bookstore. Planning begins in earnest.

After being called back into work yesterday to help avert a crisis, when well into my second glass of wine, my wife has decided that her concerns about me retiring this year and hiking the Appalachian Trail next spring are unfounded. She's a believer.

Did a test hike on part of the Paumanock Trail on Long Island. I got horribly lost because of poor blazing. I didn't have a very good map either. I was planning on a 3 day hike from the Pine Barrens Trail Office on County Road 111 and the LIE heading towards East Hampton. I'd done the Montauk Point to East Hampton section years ago, and was hoping to knock out this center section. The nearest water was a good 20 miles from where I started, so I couldn't really afford to dilly dally. But after getting off on several wrong trails it was obvious I wasn't going to make it to water before the end of the day. So unfortunately I had to abort until I get a good map.
